title: Logical Model Enumeration Schema
description: JSON Schema defining the structure of the Logical Model enumeration endpoint response

url.description: Relative URL to the schema file

logicalModelUrl.description: FHIR canonical URL of the Logical Model

propertyCount.description: Number of properties in the Logical Model

schemas.title: Functional and Non-Functional Requirements (DAK)
schemas.description: Logical Model for representing Functional and Non-Functional Requirements from a DAK. A high-level list of core functions and capabilities that the system must have to meet the end users' needs.

schemas.title: Health Interventions and Recommendations (DAK)
schemas.description: Logical Model for representing Health Interventions and Recommendations from a DAK. Overview of the health interventions and WHO, regional or national recommendations included within the DAK.

schemas.title: Core Data Element (DAK)
schemas.description: Logical Model for representing Core Data Elements from a DAK. Data elements are required throughout the different points of a workflow and are mapped to established concept mapping standards.

schemas.title: Program Indicator (DAK)
schemas.description: Logical Model for representing Program Indicators from a DAK. Core set of indicators that need to be aggregated for decision-making, performance metrics and subnational and national reporting.

schemas.title: Test Scenario (DAK)
schemas.description: Logical Model for representing Test Scenarios from a DAK. A set of test scenarios to validate an implementation of the DAK.

schemas.title: Generic Persona (DAK)
schemas.description: Logical Model for representing Generic Personas from a DAK. Depiction of the human and system actors. Human actors are end users, supervisors and related stakeholders who would be interacting with the digital system or involved in the clinical care, public health or health system pathway.

schemas.title: Decision-Support Logic (DAK)
schemas.description: Logical Model for representing Decision-Support Logic from a DAK. Decision-support logic and algorithms to support appropriate service delivery in accordance with WHO clinical, public health and data use guidelines.

schemas.title: Persona (DAK)
schemas.description: Logical Model for representing Personas from a DAK

schemas.title: Dublin Core Metadata Element Set
schemas.description: Logical Model representing Dublin Core metadata elements as defined at https://www.dublincore.org/specifications/dublin-core/dcmi-terms/

schemas.title: Non-Functional Requirement (DAK)
schemas.description: Logical Model for representing non-functional requirement from a DAK

schemas.title: User Scenario (DAK)
schemas.description: Logical Model for representing User Scenarios from a DAK. Narratives that describe how the different personas may interact with each other.

schemas.title: Functional Requirement (DAK)
schemas.description: Logical Model for representing functional requirement from a DAK

schemas.title: Business Process Workflow (DAK)
schemas.description: Logical Model for representing Generic Business Processes and Workflows from a DAK. A business process is a set of related activities or tasks performed together to achieve the objectives of the health programme area.

schemas.title: SUSHI Configuration Logical Model
schemas.description: Logical model defining the structure of sushi-config.yaml files used for FHIR Implementation Guide configuration. This model captures the essential metadata and configuration parameters needed for IG publishing.

schemas.title: Digital Adaptation Kit (DAK)
schemas.description: Logical Model for representing a complete Digital Adaptation Kit (DAK) with metadata and all 9 DAK components
